credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Edwin Howland Blashfield
creation_date: Late Ptolemaic-Early Roman Period (200 BC -30 BC), Ptolemaic Dynasty
title: Statuette of Harpokrates, Standing with Cornucopia
description: This terracotta votive statuette depicts the Egyptian god, Harpokrates. He is nude and his head clean shaven except for his trademark side-lock. He holds his index finger to his lips in a gesture symbolizing his youth. Mold-made statuettes of this type were mass-produced in Egypt throughout the Ptolemaic and Roman periods.
